description: I installed devstack yesterday, and I got everything working finally, but I could not get the floating IP's to work. I looked and looked, and I saw a bunch of "sudo arping" when I ran `ps -ef`, and I killed them all, and iptables was then populated correctly. I'm not sure where to see why it's getting stuck, as there isn't a log file.
title: nova-network stuck on 'sudo arping'

comments.content: I installed devstack yesterday, and I got everything working finally, but I could not get the floating IP's to work. I looked and looked, and I saw a bunch of "sudo arping" when I ran `ps -ef`, and I killed them all, and iptables was then populated correctly. I'm not sure where to see why it's getting stuck, as there isn't a log file.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bradleelandis

comments.content: This is because there arping wasn't in the sudoers file.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anotherjesse

comments.content: I think this was a devstack issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bradleelandis

comments.content: Incidentally, by default the services log to their respective screens.  You can also enable syslog with the env variable SYSLOG=True
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sleepsonthefloor
